query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
1 Nel tempo che Iunone era crucciata 2 per Semelè contra ’l sangue tebano, 3 come mostrò una e altra fïata,
4 Atamante divenne tanto insano, 5 che veggendo la moglie con due figli 6 andar carcata da ciascuna mano,
7 gridò: «Tendiam le reti, sì ch’io pigli 8 la leonessa e ’ leoncini al varco»; 9 e poi distese i dispietati artigli,
10 prendendo l’un ch’avea nome Learco, 11 e rotollo e percosselo ad un sasso; 12 e quella s’annegò con l’altro carco.
query.result:
**English:**
1 At the time when Juno was angered 2 against Semele, against the Theban blood, 3 as she showed on more than one occasion,
4 Athamas became so insane 5 that, seeing his wife with two children 6 walking burdened on each hand,
7 he shouted: "Let's spread the nets, so that I may catch 8 the lioness and the lion cubs at the pass"; 9 and then he stretched out his pitiless claws,
10 seizing the one whose name was Learchus, 11 and he swung him and dashed him against a rock; 12 and she drowned herself with the other burden.
**Malay:**
1 Pada masa ketika Juno sedang marah 2 terhadap Semele, terhadap darah Thebes, 3 seperti yang ditunjukkannya pada lebih dari satu kesempatan,
4 Athamas menjadi sangat gila 5 sehingga, melihat istrinya dengan dua anak 6 berjalan dengan beban di setiap tangan,
7 dia berteriak: "Bentangkan jaring, agar aku dapat menangkap 8 singa betina dan anak-anak singa di celah gunung"; 9 dan kemudian dia mengulurkan cakarnya yang kejam,
10 menangkap yang satu yang bernama Learchus, 11 dan dia mengayunkannya dan membantingnya ke batu; 12 dan dia menenggelamkan dirinya dengan beban lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
13 E quando la fortuna volse in basso 14 l’altezza de’ Troian che tutto ardiva, 15 sì che ’nsieme col regno il re fu casso,
16 Ecuba trista, misera e cattiva, 17 poscia che vide Polissena morta, 18 e del suo Polidoro in su la riva
19 del mar si fu la dolorosa accorta, 20 forsennata latrò sì come cane; 21 tanto il dolor le fé la mente torta.
query.result:
**English:**
13 And when fortune turned against 14 the pride of the Trojans who dared all, 15 so that together with the kingdom the king was overthrown,
16 Hecuba, sad, wretched, and evil, 17 after she saw Polyxena dead, 18 and on the shore of the sea she became aware of her Polydorus,
19 distraught, she howled like a dog; 20 so much did grief twist her mind.
**Malay:**
13 Dan ketika nasib berbalik melawan 14 keangkuhan Trojan yang berani melakukan segalanya, 15 sehingga bersama dengan kerajaan, raja itu digulingkan,
16 Hecuba yang sedih, malang, dan jahat, 17 setelah dia melihat Polyxena mati, 18 dan di tepi laut dia menyadari Polydorus-nya,
19 putus asa, dia melolong seperti anjing; 20 begitu banyak kesedihan yang memutarbalikkan pikirannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
22 Ma né di Tebe furie né troiane 23 si vider mäi in alcun tanto crude, 24 non punger bestie, nonché membra umane,
25 quant’ io vidi in due ombre smorte e nude, 26 che mordendo correvan di quel modo 27 che ’l porco quando del porcil si schiude.
query.result:
**English:**
22 But neither in Thebes nor Troy 23 were Furies ever seen so cruel, 24 not even tearing at beasts, let alone human limbs,
25 as I saw in two pale and naked shades, 26 who ran biting each other in the way 27 that a hog does when it bursts out of the sty.
**Malay:**
22 Tetapi tidak di Thebes mahupun Troy 23 para dewi pembalasan pernah terlihat sedemikian kejamnya, 24 tidak juga menerkam binatang buas, apalagi anggota tubuh manusia,
25 seperti yang kulihat pada dua bayangan pucat dan telanjang, 26 yang saling menggigit sambil berlari dengan cara 27 seperti babi hutan ketika keluar dari kandangnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
28 L’una giunse a Capocchio, e in sul nodo 29 del collo l’assannò, sì che, tirando, 30 grattar li fece il ventre al fondo sodo.
query.result:
**English:**
28 One reached Capocchio, and at the nape 29 of his neck he seized him, so that, pulling, 30 he made him scrape his belly on the hard bottom.
**Malay:**
28 Yang satu sampai di Capocchio, dan di simpul 29 lehernya ia menerkamnya, sehingga, sambil menarik, 30 ia membuat perutnya tergores di dasar yang keras.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
31 E l’Aretin che rimase, tremando 32 mi disse: «Quel folletto è Gianni Schicchi, 33 e va rabbioso altrui così conciando».
query.result:
**English:**
31 And the Aretine, who remained trembling, 32 said to me: "That imp is Gianni Schicchi, 33 and he goes about thus tormenting others."
**Malay:**
31 Dan si Aretin yang masih gemetar, 32 berkata kepadaku: "Imp itu adalah Gianni Schicchi, 33 dan dia pergi dengan marah menyiksa orang lain seperti itu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
34 «Oh», diss’ io lui, «se l’altro non ti ficchi 35 li denti a dosso, non ti sia fatica 36 a dir chi è, pria che di qui si spicchi».
query.result:
**English:**
34 "Oh," I said to him, "if the other one doesn't sink 35 his teeth into your back, don't let it be a bother 36 to tell me who he is, before he leaves here."
**Malay:**
34 "Oh," kataku kepadanya, "jika yang lain tidak menancapkan 35 giginya ke punggungmu, jangan biarkan itu menjadi masalah 36 untuk memberitahuku siapa dia, sebelum dia pergi dari sini."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
37 Ed elli a me: «Quell’ è l’anima antica 38 di Mirra scellerata, che divenne 39 al padre, fuor del dritto amore, amica.
query.result:
**English:**
37 And he to me: "That is the ancient soul 38 of sinful Myrrha, who became 39 her father's mistress, outside of rightful love.
**Malay:**
37 Dan dia kepadaku: "Itu adalah jiwa kuno 38 dari Myrrha yang jahat, yang menjadi 39 kekasih ayahnya, di luar cinta yang sah.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
40 Questa a peccar con esso così venne, 41 falsificando sé in altrui forma, 42 come l’altro che là sen va, sostenne,
43 per guadagnar la donna de la torma, 44 falsificare in sé Buoso Donati, 45 testando e dando al testamento norma».
query.result:
**English:**
40 This one came to sin with him in this way, 41 disguising herself in another form, 42 as the other one who goes there sustained,
43 in order to gain the lady of the tower, 44 disguising himself as Buoso Donati, 45 making a will and giving instructions for the testament.
**Malay:**
40 Yang ini datang untuk berbuat dosa dengannya dengan cara ini, 41 menyamarkan dirinya dalam bentuk orang lain, 42 seperti yang lainnya yang pergi ke sana berpendapat,
43 untuk mendapatkan wanita dari menara, 44 menyamarkan dirinya sebagai Buoso Donati, 45 membuat surat wasiat dan memberikan instruksi untuk surat wasiat tersebut.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
46 E poi che i due rabbiosi fuor passati 47 sovra cu’ io avea l’occhio tenuto, 48 rivolsilo a guardar li altri mal nati.
query.result:
**English:**
46 And after the two rabid ones had passed by 47 over whom I had kept my eye, 48 I turned to look at the other ill-born creatures.
**Malay:**
46 Dan setelah kedua makhluk yang ganas itu berlalu 47 yang kepadanya aku telah mengarahkan pandanganku, 48 aku berpaling untuk melihat makhluk-makhluk jahat lainnya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
49 Io vidi un, fatto a guisa di lëuto, 50 pur ch’elli avesse avuta l’anguinaia 51 tronca da l’altro che l’uomo ha forcuto.
query.result:
**English:**
49 I saw one, made in the likeness of a lute, 50 except that he had the groin 51 cut off from the other part that man has forked.
**Malay:**
49 Aku melihat seseorang, dibuat menyerupai kecapi, 50 kecuali bahwa ia memiliki selangkangan 51 terpotong dari bagian lain yang bercabang pada manusia.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
52 La grave idropesì, che sì dispaia 53 le membra con l’omor che mal converte, 54 che ’l viso non risponde a la ventraia,
55 faceva lui tener le labbra aperte 56 come l’etico fa, che per la sete 57 l’un verso ’l mento e l’altro in sù rinverte.
query.result:
**English:**
52 The heavy dropsy, that so disfigures 53 the limbs with the humor that it ill transforms, 54 that the face does not correspond to the belly,
55 made him hold his lips open, 56 as the hectic does, who because of thirst 57 turns one lip toward his chin and the other upward.
**Malay:**
52 Penyakit busung yang parah, yang begitu merusak 53 anggota tubuh dengan cairan yang tidak dapat diubah dengan baik, 54 sehingga wajah tidak sesuai dengan perut,
55 membuatnya membuka bibirnya, 56 seperti penderita etika, yang karena haus 57 memutar satu bibir ke arah dagunya dan yang lainnya ke atas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
58 «O voi che sanz’ alcuna pena siete, 59 e non so io perché, nel mondo gramo», 60 diss’ elli a noi, «guardate e attendete
61 a la miseria del maestro Adamo; 62 io ebbi, vivo, assai di quel ch’i’ volli, 63 e ora, lasso!, un gocciol d’acqua bramo.
query.result:
**English:**
58 "O you who are without any pain, 59 and I do not know why, in this wretched world," 60 he said to us, "look and pay attention
61 to the misery of Master Adam; 62 I had, while alive, plenty of what I wanted, 63 and now, alas, I crave a single drop of water.
**Malay:**
58 "Wahai kamu yang tanpa sebarang kesakitan, 59 dan aku tidak tahu mengapa, di dunia yang celaka ini," 60 katanya kepada kami, "lihatlah dan perhatikanlah
61 kepada kesengsaraan Tuan Adam; 62 aku memiliki, semasa hidup, banyak dari apa yang kuinginkan, 63 dan sekarang, aduh!, setetes air yang kuinginkan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
64 Li ruscelletti che d’i verdi colli 65 del Casentin discendon giuso in Arno, 66 faccendo i lor canali freddi e molli,
67 sempre mi stanno innanzi, e non indarno, 68 ché l’imagine lor vie più m’asciuga 69 che ’l male ond’ io nel volto mi discarno.
query.result:
**English:**
64 The little streams that descend from the green hills 65 of Casentino down into the Arno, 66 making their channels cool and soft,
67 are always before me, and not in vain, 68 for their image dries me out even more 69 than the sickness that makes my face gaunt.
**Malay:**
64 Anak-anak sungai yang mengalir dari bukit-bukit hijau 65 Casentino turun ke Arno, 66 membuat saluran mereka sejuk dan lembut,
67 selalu ada di hadapanku, dan tidak sia-sia, 68 karena bayangan mereka lebih mengeringkanku 69 daripada penyakit yang membuat wajahku kurus kering.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
70 La rigida giustizia che mi fruga 71 tragge cagion del loco ov’ io peccai 72 a metter più li miei sospiri in fuga.
query.result:
**English:**
70 The harsh justice that searches me 71 draws reason from the place where I sinned 72 to put my sighs more to flight.
**Malay:**
70 Keadilan yang keras yang menggeledahku 71 menarik sebab dari tempat di mana aku berdosa 72 untuk membuat desahanku lebih melarikan diri.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
73 Ivi è Romena, là dov’ io falsai 74 la lega suggellata del Batista; 75 per ch’io il corpo sù arso lasciai.
query.result:
**English:**
73 There is Romagna, where I falsified 74 the coin stamped with the Baptist; 75 for which I left my body burned above.
**Malay:**
73 Di sana ada Romagna, di mana aku memalsukan 74 koin yang dicap dengan gambar Pembaptis; 75 karena itu aku meninggalkan tubuhku terbakar di atas.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
76 Ma s’io vedessi qui l’anima trista 77 di Guido o d’Alessandro o di lor frate, 78 per Fonte Branda non darei la vista.
query.result:
**English:**
76 But if I saw here the sorrowful soul 77 of Guido or Alessandro or their brother, 78 I would not give up the sight for Fonte Branda.
**Malay:**
76 Tetapi jika aku melihat di sini jiwa yang bersedih 77 dari Guido atau Alessandro atau saudara mereka, 78 aku tidak akan menyerahkan pemandangan itu untuk Fonte Branda.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
79 Dentro c’è l’una già, se l’arrabbiate 80 ombre che vanno intorno dicon vero; 81 ma che mi val, c’ho le membra legate?
82 S’io fossi pur di tanto ancor leggero 83 ch’i’ potessi in cent’ anni andare un’oncia, 84 io sarei messo già per lo sentiero,
85 cercando lui tra questa gente sconcia, 86 con tutto ch’ella volge undici miglia, 87 e men d’un mezzo di traverso non ci ha.
query.result:
**English:**
79 Inside there is already one, if the angry 80 shades that go around are telling the truth; 81 but what good is it to me, since my limbs are bound?
82 If only I were still so light 83 that I could go an inch in a hundred years, 84 I would already be on the path,
85 searching for him among these vile people, 86 even though it goes around eleven miles, 87 and there is less than half a day's journey across it.
**Malay:**
79 Di dalamnya sudah ada satu, jika bayangan-bayangan marah 80 yang berkeliaran di sekitar itu mengatakan yang sebenarnya; 81 tetapi apa gunanya bagiku, karena anggota tubuhku terikat?
82 Jika saja aku masih seringan itu 83 sehingga aku bisa berjalan satu inci dalam seratus tahun, 84 aku pasti sudah berada di jalan setapak,
85 mencarinya di antara orang-orang keji ini, 86 meskipun itu berputar sekitar sebelas mil, 87 dan jaraknya kurang dari setengah hari perjalanan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
88 Io son per lor tra sì fatta famiglia; 89 e’ m’indussero a batter li fiorini 90 ch’avevan tre carati di mondiglia».
query.result:
**English:**
88 I am among them for such a family; 89 and they induced me to strike the florins 90 that had three carats of alloy.
**Malay:**
88 Aku berada di antara mereka untuk keluarga seperti itu; 89 dan mereka membujukku untuk memukul florin 90 yang memiliki tiga karat campuran logam.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
91 E io a lui: «Chi son li due tapini 92 che fumman come man bagnate ’l verno, 93 giacendo stretti a’ tuoi destri confini?».
query.result:
**English:**
91 And I to him: "Who are those two wretches 92 who smoke like wet hands in winter, 93 lying huddled at your right confines?".
**Malay:**
91 Dan aku kepadanya: "Siapakah kedua orang malang itu 92 yang berasap seperti tangan basah di musim dingin, 93 terbaring meringkuk di batas kananmu?".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
94 «Qui li trovai—e poi volta non dierno—», 95 rispuose, «quando piovvi in questo greppo, 96 e non credo che dieno in sempiterno.
query.result:
**English:**
94 "Here I found them—and then they did not turn away—", 95 he replied, "when I fell into this chasm, 96 and I do not think that they will ever turn away.
**Malay:**
94 "Di sini aku menemukan mereka—dan kemudian mereka tidak berpaling—", 95 jawabnya, "ketika aku jatuh ke dalam jurang ini, 96 dan aku tidak berpikir bahwa mereka akan pernah berpaling.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
97 L’una è la falsa ch’accusò Gioseppo; 98 l’altr’ è ’l falso Sinon greco di Troia: 99 per febbre aguta gittan tanto leppo».
query.result:
**English:**
97 One is the false one who accused Joseph; 98 the other is the false Greek Sinon of Troy: 99 with a high fever they threw out so much filth.
**Malay:**
97 Yang satu adalah yang palsu yang menuduh Yusuf; 98 yang lainnya adalah Sinon Yunani palsu dari Troya: 99 dengan demam tinggi mereka mengeluarkan begitu banyak kotoran.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
100 E l’un di lor, che si recò a noia 101 forse d’esser nomato sì oscuro, 102 col pugno li percosse l’epa croia.
query.result:
**English:**
100 And one of them, who was annoyed 101 perhaps at being named so obscurely, 102 struck him on the hollow of his chest with his fist.
**Malay:**
100 Dan salah seorang dari mereka, yang merasa jengkel 101 mungkin karena disebutkan dengan begitu samar, 102 memukul dadanya dengan tinjunya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
103 Quella sonò come fosse un tamburo; 104 e mastro Adamo li percosse il volto 105 col braccio suo, che non parve men duro,
106 dicendo a lui: «Ancor che mi sia tolto 107 lo muover per le membra che son gravi, 108 ho io il braccio a tal mestiere sciolto».
query.result:
**English:**
103 That one sounded as if it were a drum; 104 and Master Adam struck them in the face 105 with his arm, which did not seem less hard,
106 saying to him: "Even though it is taken from me 107 to move through the limbs that are heavy, 108 I have my arm loosened for such a task."
**Malay:**
103 Yang itu berbunyi seolah-olah seperti genderang; 104 dan Tuan Adam memukul wajah mereka 105 dengan lengannya, yang tampaknya tidak kalah keras,
106 berkata kepadanya: "Meskipun aku tidak dapat 107 bergerak melalui anggota tubuh yang berat ini, 108 lenganku bebas untuk tugas seperti itu."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
109 Ond’ ei rispuose: «Quando tu andavi 110 al fuoco, non l’avei tu così presto; 111 ma sì e più l’avei quando coniavi».
query.result:
**English:**
109 Then he replied: "When you went 110 to the fire, you did not have it so quickly; 111 but you had it so and more when you were coining".
**Malay:**
109 Kemudian dia menjawab: "Ketika kamu pergi 110 ke api, kamu tidak memilikinya secepat itu; 111 tetapi kamu memilikinya begitu dan lebih banyak ketika kamu sedang membuat koin".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
112 E l’idropico: «Tu di’ ver di questo: 113 ma tu non fosti sì ver testimonio 114 là ’ve del ver fosti a Troia richesto».
query.result:
**English:**
112 And the dropsical man: "You speak truly about this, 113 but you were not such a true witness 114 there where you were asked about the truth at Troy."
**Malay:**
112 Dan si sakit busung air: "Kamu berkata benar tentang ini: 113 tetapi kamu tidak menjadi saksi yang benar 114 di sana di mana kamu ditanya tentang kebenaran di Troya."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
115 «S’io dissi falso, e tu falsasti il conio», 116 disse Sinon; «e son qui per un fallo, 117 e tu per più ch’alcun altro demonio!».
query.result:
**English:**
115 "If I spoke falsely, and you falsified the coin," 116 said Sinon; "and I am here for one fault, 117 and you for more than any other devil!"
**Malay:**
115 "Jika aku berkata palsu, dan kamu memalsukan koin," 116 kata Sinon; "dan aku di sini karena satu kesalahan, 117 dan kamu karena lebih dari iblis lainnya!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
118 «Ricorditi, spergiuro, del cavallo», 119 rispuose quel ch’avëa infiata l’epa; 120 «e sieti reo che tutto il mondo sallo!».
query.result:
**English:**
118 "Remember, perjurer, about the horse," 119 replied he who had puffed out his belly; 120 "and may you be damned so that the whole world knows it!"
**Malay:**
118 "Ingatlah, wahai penipu, tentang kuda itu," 119 jawabnya yang telah menggembungkan perutnya; 120 "dan celakalah kamu sehingga seluruh dunia mengetahuinya!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
121 «E te sia rea la sete onde ti crepa», 122 disse ’l Greco, «la lingua, e l’acqua marcia 123 che ’l ventre innanzi a li occhi sì t’assiepa!».
query.result:
**English:**
121 "And may the thirst that parches you be real," 122 said the Greek, "your tongue, and the foul water 123 that makes a hedge before your eyes!"
**Malay:**
121 "Dan semoga dahaga yang membakarmu itu nyata," 122 kata orang Yunani itu, "lidahmu, dan air busuk 123 yang membuat pagar di depan matamu!"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
124 Allora il monetier: «Così si squarcia 125 la bocca tua per tuo mal come suole; 126 ché, s’i’ ho sete e omor mi rinfarcia,
127 tu hai l’arsura e ’l capo che ti duole, 128 e per leccar lo specchio di Narcisso, 129 non vorresti a ’nvitar molte parole».
query.result:
**English:**
124 Then the money-changer: "Thus your mouth is torn open 125 for your evil as it is wont to do; 126 for if I am thirsty and gold refreshes me,
127 you have the burning thirst and the headache, 128 and to lick Narcissus' mirror, 129 you would not want to invite many words."
**Malay:**
124 Kemudian penukar uang itu: "Demikianlah mulutmu terkoyak 125 karena kejahatanmu seperti biasanya; 126 karena, jika aku haus dan emas menyegarkanku,
127 kamu memiliki rasa haus yang membara dan sakit kepala, 128 dan untuk menjilat cermin Narcissus, 129 kamu tidak ingin mengundang banyak kata."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
130 Ad ascoltarli er’ io del tutto fisso, 131 quando ’l maestro mi disse: «Or pur mira, 132 che per poco che teco non mi risso!».
query.result:
**English:**
130 I was completely absorbed in listening to them, 131 when the master said to me: "Now just look, 132 because I almost quarreled with you!".
**Malay:**
130 Aku benar-benar asyik mendengarkan mereka, 131 ketika sang guru berkata kepadaku: "Sekarang lihatlah, 132 karena sedikit lagi aku hampir bertengkar denganmu!".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
133 Quand’ io ’l senti’ a me parlar con ira, 134 volsimi verso lui con tal vergogna, 135 ch’ancor per la memoria mi si gira.
query.result:
**English:**
133 When I heard him speak to me with anger, 134 I turned to him with such shame, 135 that even now the memory makes me turn.
**Malay:**
133 Ketika aku mendengarnya berbicara kepadaku dengan marah, 134 aku berpaling kepadanya dengan rasa malu yang sedemikian rupa, 135 sehingga bahkan sekarang kenangan itu membuatku berpaling.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
136 Qual è colui che suo dannaggio sogna, 137 che sognando desidera sognare, 138 sì che quel ch’è, come non fosse, agogna,
139 tal mi fec’ io, non possendo parlare, 140 che disïava scusarmi, e scusava 141 me tuttavia, e nol mi credea fare.
query.result:
**English:**
136 Like one who dreams of his loss, 137 and in dreaming desires to dream, 138 so that what is, he yearns for as if it were not,
139 thus I did, not being able to speak, 140 for I desired to excuse myself, and I excused 141 myself all the while, and I did not believe I was doing so.
**Malay:**
136 Seperti orang yang memimpikan kerugiannya, 137 yang dalam mimpi ingin terus bermimpi, 138 sehingga apa yang ada, ia dambakan seolah-olah tidak ada,
139 begitulah yang kulakukan, karena tidak dapat berbicara, 140 karena aku ingin meminta maaf, dan aku meminta maaf 141 sepanjang waktu, dan aku tidak percaya bahwa aku melakukannya.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
142 «Maggior difetto men vergogna lava», 143 disse ’l maestro, «che ’l tuo non è stato; 144 però d’ogne trestizia ti disgrava.
query.result:
**English:**
142 “A greater fault washes away my shame,” 143 said the master, “than yours has been; 144 therefore, free yourself from all sadness.
**Malay:**
142 “Kesalahan yang lebih besar menghapuskan rasa maluku,” 143 kata sang guru, “daripada kesalahanmu; 144 oleh karena itu, bebaskan dirimu dari semua kesedihan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Malay.
145 E fa ragion ch’io ti sia sempre allato, 146 se più avvien che fortuna t’accoglia 147 dove sien genti in simigliante piato:
148 ché voler ciò udire è bassa voglia».
query.result:
**English:**
145 And it is right that I should always be by your side, 146 if fortune should ever bring you 147 where there are people in similar strife:
148 for to want to hear about this is a base desire.
**Malay:**
145 Dan adalah benar bahwa aku harus selalu berada di sisimu, 146 jika nasib membawamu 147 di mana ada orang-orang dalam pertikaian yang sama:
148 karena keinginan untuk mendengar ini adalah keinginan yang rendah.
